column1: This set was not bad. As was with http://brickset.com/detail/?Set=20003-1
column2: (Creator BM), this was a gift from a friend who gets Brickmaster.

column1: The building didn't take long. There were no difficult parts, considering this set only has about 60 pieces.

column5: one-dot slicks"" are handy for if you are one of those people who have those mosaic sets. Back on the green shingles, they are a nice trick to making the rough skin.

column1: The beige and brown pieces aren't a realistic underbelly color in my opinion. I guess LEGO didn't want to have to make a whole new color for the ""two-dot"" clip for the hinge of the back of the tail, but I have no clue.
A decent set. It can be used for many things such as it eating minifigs in your lego movies! :)

Kyogre95147,"2010-06-11T03:59:02.593Z","A really cool set","

This is a nice little set that comes with the May/June Brickmaster. It's a crocodile that is pretty easy to build but is fairly big. The jaws are moveable so it has some kind of playability . The magazine it comes with also includes alternate instrucions to build into a frog. I would definatly recomend it but, unfortunatly it is Brickmaster exlusive.

",TRUE,4,4,5,4,4

TooMuchLEGO,"2011-02-11T17:27:09.357Z","Crocodile Rock","This cute little crocodile was a very fun build. Its mouth can open and close, and its tail can move up and down. The legs cannot do this however, but it's quite alright. There are a lot of nifty little pieces in here- such as a lot of green (obviously). The light green scale pieces are my favorite- they are hard to come by and this set comes with quite a few. My sister enjoys this product a lot- she pretends it is my pet crocodile and sometimes he's a zoo animal. Overall it's a great set and everyone will love it, big or small. Not sure if the real crocodiles will though.
